Trump Fires U.S. Attorney Who Investigated His Associates, Barr SaysPresident Trump personally fired the U.S. attorney in Manhattan, Geoffrey Berman, who has pursued cases that have rankled Mr. Trump and his allies.After initially resisting, Mr. Berman said he would step down, ending a standoff with the administration after it agreed to let his deputy succeed him.

A Low-Profile Regulator Is Catapulted Into a Political FightJay Clayton, the head of the S.E.C., is now the Trump administration’s intended nominee to be the top prosecutor for the Southern District of New York.
Who has the power to fire a court-appointed U.S. attorney?

Six Trump Campaign Workers Test Positive for VirusPresident Trump, made aware of the sick aides before departing for Tulsa, Okla., was said to be incensed that the news was made public.The 19,000-seat BOK Center remained underfilled, with a crowd awaiting the president that was well below the campaign’s expectations. Here’s the latest.

Waiting for Trump: Hats, Flags and Little Fear of the VirusThe line of supporters awaiting President Trump’s first rally since the pandemic offered a vivid illustration of his sway over the Republican base.
Rally Has Tulsa on Edge as Thousands Pack TogetherPresident Trump shrugged off health warnings and dismissed the symbolism of restarting his rallies in a city where a mob once massacred black people.

U.S. Cases Surge, With Clusters Linked to Bars and PartiesThe U.S. reported more than 30,000 new infections on Friday, its highest total since May 1, with cases rising in 19 states. Here’s the latest.

Latin America’s Virus Villains: Corrupt Officials, Colluding With Price GougersThe coronavirus has devastated Latin America, and it has only been worsened by a wave of graft and profiteering, prosecutors say.

Judge Rejects Trump Request for Order Blocking John Bolton’s MemoirBut the judge also sharply criticized Mr. Bolton, the former national security adviser, suggesting his $2 million book advance may be in jeopardy.
A Republican senator and President Trump could both be in trouble in Iowa.
Chris Thomas delivering a sermon at First Baptist Church of Williams in Jacksonville, Ala. Calla Kessler/The New York Times
After George Floyd, Fresh Scrutiny of Old CasesIn the wake of Mr. Floyd’s death, several deadly episodes involving the police are receiving renewed attention.
